DOCNAME: CASE OF SASSNE SARI v. HUNGARY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: András Sajó;Antonella Mularoni;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Bag .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant divorced her husband . The ex - spouses had an agreement about the placement of their son with the applicant . However , on DATE the ex - husband took the son with him on a trip and did not return him to the applicant . Despite several enforcement fines imposed on the father , the applicant ’s custody was restored only on DATE .
CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE the father introduced an action requesting custody of the child .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , after having held several hearings and obtained the opinion of an expert , adopted a decision , changing the child ’s placement and granting custody to the father . On appeal , on DATE ORG quashed this decision .
CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , on DATE ORG , after having held several hearings and obtained the opinion of an expert , again found for the father .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld this decision and ordered the applicant to surrender the child to the father . This decision was served on the applicant ’s lawyer on DATE .
